- For gene B: Parent 1 is BB, so all offspring will inherit B from Parent 1. Parent 2 is bb, so all offspring will inherit b from Parent 2. Therefore, all F2 will be Bb.

- cc → Plain

- bb → Checkered

The number of each combination depends on the probability of each gene combination. Since the genes are independent, the probability of each combination is the product of the probabilities of each gene.
